Razing a city transfers half that city's population to your capital. When men or fallen are defeated in combat they are transferred as population to your nearest city.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows this unit to cast any spell the sovereign can cast.

GameModifier.Provides: Allows this unit to cast any spell the sovereign can cast.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Barbs

GameModifier.Provides: Does 16 damage to the target and the caster.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Beguile

GameModifier.Provides: Victim has a 50% chance to swing at a random unit in melee instead of his target, unless they resist.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Blindness

GameModifier.Provides: Target enemy is stricken blind, resulting in a 50% penalty to Accuracy unless they resist.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Blizzard

GameModifier.Provides: Assaults target foes with an ice storm, dealing 6 cold damage to each unit in the area of effect. Damage is multiplied by the members of the victims unit.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Call Slag

GameModifier.Provides: Summons a Slag or the smaller River Slag

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to summon Uteran into battle

GameModifier.Provides: Summons Uteran, a level 4 Cave Bear.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Chain Lightning

GameModifier.Provides: Creates a lightning storm which does up 1-20 Lighting damage to all enemy units within the area of effect

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Cloak of Fear

GameModifier.Provides: Enemies must make a spell resistance check or they are unable to attack a unit protected by this enchantment.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Coal Stones

GameModifier.Provides: Lances of fire strike all enemy units for double the caster's level in fire damage. This damage is halved if the victim resists.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Confusion

GameModifier.Provides: All enemies have a 50% chance to swing at a random unit in melee instead of their target, unless they resist.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Contagion

GameModifier.Provides: All enemy units take 3 poison damage per turn for 10 turns, unless they resist

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Counterspell
Allows the unit to cast Curse

GameModifier.Provides: Target has no Defense for 3 turns unless they resist

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Completely heals the unit and does the amount healed as poison damage to all enemies

GameModifier.Provides: Heals the caster and does damage equal to the amount healed to all enemies

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Delin's Breath

GameModifier.Provides: Delin's Breath summons a fireball that shoots at all enemies. These fireballs do 18 (+6 per fire shard) fire damage to all units within a 1 tile radius. Damage is halved if the target resists

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Demonic Ally
Allows the unit to cast Despair

GameModifier.Provides: Transfers 3 hit points per level from all enemies to the caster. That damage is halved if the enemy resists

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Embers

GameModifier.Provides: Needles of fire shoot at an enemy for for 4 (+2 per level) damage

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Feed the Fire

GameModifier.Provides: +3 Fire Attack. Feed the Fire is stackable

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Fireball

GameModifier.Provides: A fireball does 4 fire damage to all units within a 1 tile radius. Damage is multiplied by the members of the victims unit

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Howl

GameModifier.Provides: All allied units get +1 Attack per Level of the Caster for the rest of the battle

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Hurl Boulder

GameModifier.Provides: Launches a boulder for 8 blunt damage (+2 per level)

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Imprison

GameModifier.Provides: Target enemy is immobilized for 5 rounds and takes 5 damage per round, unless they resist

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Obsession

This faction can train Iron Golems with the Blacksmithing technology. Iron Golems are powerful defenders and able to withstand inhuman amounts of damage before being destroyed.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Carved from the carapace of the elemental, the pupil inside this giant yellow orb still moves and looks around. (+10% growth, +5 Attack for defending units)
This head is a gruesome reminder of the cost of attempting to appease the titans. (+10% growth, +1 attack for defending units)
This fissured black stone still glows with the fire of the elemental lord it used to be a part of. (+10% growth, 50% fire resistance for defending units)

The heart of Morian, Ruin of Summer. Deep within his corrupted shell was a heart that still remembered verdant forests and unscarred lands. (+10% growth, +5 hit points for all units trained in this city)
Broken off of the fallen dragon, this horn is proof of the power of the civilization that holds it. (+10% growth)
The wind howls continually through the mouth of the dismembered head of this elemental lord. (+10% growth, +10% gildar)
Shattered off of the elemental lord, this icy fist is still as cold as the arctic and as hard as granite. (+10% growth, 50% cold resistance for defending units)

Player starts with two Bandit units and has the ability to convert bandits

Constructing improvements takes 25% longer
The unit heals at 1 point per season regardless of level

GameModifier.Provides: Heals at 1 point per season regardless of level

AbilityBonusOption.Description: -20 to Spell Resistance
Enables Conclave improvements and increases research by 50% when the production queue is empty.
Enables Fortress improvements and increases the level of units trained here by 1. Select this to dedicate your city to defense and military pursuits.
Enables Town improvements and increases Zone of Control by 1. Select this to dedicate your city to growth and financial pursuits.
Archivists increase the Research a city provides by 50% when the city's production queue is empty.
Guild Grocers improve the Hit Points of all your units by 10%.
Infirmaries provide +1 Growth and heal 10 Hit Points per season to units that are stationed in the city.
An Oracle allows you to tap into the magic of Elemental, adding an additional Essence to the city.
Scroll Scribes increase Research by 20% and make scrolls available for your champions to purchase.
Slums increase the Growth of your city by 3, but also increase Unrest by 10%.
Strike Garrisons give all units trained in this city the Impulsive trait (the ability to go first in combat).
+50% Gildar when the queue is empty.
Watchtowers give defending units +5 to Initiative and provide the city with a free Catapult when defending.
The Academy of Revelation increases the Research produced by in all your cities by 10%.
An Almshouse shows a city's compassion for the least of its citizens. It increases your Faction Prestige by 1.
Amethyst Vaults provide +1 Crystal per season.
Embassies produce 1 Influence per Season.
Gallows remind your citizens of their civic duty. With them there is no Unrest penalty to Production.
Governor's Office gives you +1 Production per Material in all of your cities.
The Mining Guild provides +1 Metal per season.
Prisons reduce Unrest in your cities by 10% but decreases the Growth of this city by 1.
A legendary wonder of a past age, the Pyre of Anniellum produces 3 Mana per season and strengthens your Fire spells.
The Great Arena increases your Faction Prestige by 1. All units trained in this city will have +1 to Attack and +3 to Hit Points.
Placing a Guild Lendinghouse in your city gives you 2000 gildar.
The Guild Tribunal manages all your craftsmen, increasing your production per Material by 2 across your empire.

What was once a natural spring, which remained cool even in the hottest summers, became a popular destination for travelers and a place where even warring tribes could meet in peace and relax. After the cataclysm the waters of the spring were still revered and a magnificent bathhouse was built around them.
The Mint of Ruvenna produces 3 Gildar per Material in the city.

This throne is carved from a single piece of onyx, as brilliant and dark as the sea at night. Anyone standing before it can see their reflection within its depths, but in the reflection they are weak and prostrate.
Tenfell University keeps this city's Unrest from effecting Research.
The Tower of the Magi increases the spell resistance of all units produced in this city by 10 and protects the city from the spells of enemy casters.
+1 Earth power, -50% to Armor production times.
